getFileType

public static String getFileType(String filename)
Obtains the file type from a String filename. The resulting type includes the preceding "." For example, a filename of "world.shp" will produce a file type ".shp"

Returns:
the file type, or "" if there is no file type

constructFileWithNewType

public static File constructFileWithNewType(File originalFile,
                                            String newType)
construct a new File using existing File, by replacing the existing file type with the specified new file type - does not check if file exists

constructFileWithNewTypeIgnoreCase

public static File constructFileWithNewTypeIgnoreCase(File originalFile,
                                                      String fileType)
construct a new File using existing File and replacing its file type with the specified new file type. If the new File exists, it is returned. If the new File does not exist, then the parent directory is searched for files having the same name and a file type that is no different when case is ignored. If one or more files match, then the first such file found is returned.

For example, suppose originalFile contains "/tmp/abcd" and fileType contains ".shp". If a file exists with path name "/tmp/abcd.SHP", it will be considered a match, and an appropriate File object returned. On the other hand, if a file exists with path name "/tmp/ABCD.shp", this is not considered a match, and null is returned.

Parameters:
originalFile - a template for the new file (can contain a filetype which is replaced)
fileType - the file type for the new File
Returns:
new File for specified params, or null == the file or parent folder does not exist

rename

public static boolean rename(FileContent content,
                             String name)
rename a FileContent without altering its containing folder. Both the FileContent, and its parent must be Writable, otherwise the rename fails. The parent cannot be null, because that would mean the content was a root Folder - these cannot be renamed.

Parameters:
content - the content to be renamed
name - the new name
Returns:
true == rename ok, false == otherwise

delete

public static boolean delete(FileContent content)
delete a FileContent permanently. Both the FileContent, and its parent must be Writable, otherwise the rename fails. The parent cannot be null, because that would mean the content was a root Folder - these cannot be deleted. If the Content represents a file directory, then it must be empty, otherwise it cannot be deleted.

Parameters:
content - the content to be deleted
Returns:
true == delete ok, false == otherwise
